_header: This new fruit of which I spe…and…
_description: The seed sown in man’s heart by Christ the gardener — probably thirteen long lines irregularly rhymed; ten lines incomplete, 5 couplets, line 8 corrupt

KilkennyCorp.First Lines:
…þat ful uneþe eny more me miȝt þer on
                    bringeGod hym was þe gardiner þat gan first þat sed
                    springe…
KilkennyCorp.Last Lines:
…Þo be gan þat nue sed sumdel to catch moreAc
                    ȝut after þis meny man his blod shed þerfore
KilkennyCorp.Editions:
Seymour,  St. John Delincourt. 
             “Three Medieval Poems from Kilkenny.” 
             Proceedings of the Royal Irish Academy
         41(c) (1932-33): 205-9: 206.
Richardson,  Frances E. 
             “A Middle English Fragment from the First Book of Kilkenny.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 9 [207] (1962): 47-8: 47.
